div1.p: Mead provides an update on the bill in the House of Representatives and the Senate to grant a pension to Mabel Lazear.

Dear Madam:
div1.p:
As of interest to you, we take pleasure in quoting the
following lines from Major Wm. W. Ireland, Surgeon, U. S. A., in
response to our recent communication to the Surgeon-General of the
United States, copy of which was forwarded to you:

“The Surgeon General directs me to acknowledge
receipt of your favor of the 23rd instant, and in reply
to state that the memorandum for the President, rela-
tive to the service done by Major Carroll and Dr. Lazear,
will be prepared in this office and kept until you con-
sider it the proper time to present it.”

Dr. Mansfelde has advised you, no doubt, that the Bill
has been introduced in the House of Representatives by Hon. Edmund
H. Hinshaw of Hebraska and in the Senate by Hon. P. C. Knox of
Pennsylvania.
With very best wishes for the New Year, we remain,
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, THE MERCHANTS' ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK, By S. C. Mead
Secretary.
